ipl::CPlane< T > Class Template Reference

Definines a plane by two vectors and a point. More...

#include <ipl98/cpp/geometry/plane.h>

List of all members.

Public Methods

  • CPlane ()
    Default constructor, plane point defaults to (0,0,0), the two directions to (1,0,0) and (0,1,0).

  • CPlane (const CPoint3D< T > &P, const CVector3D< T > &DirA, const CVector3D< T > &DirB)
    Constructor defining the plane.

  • CPlane (const CPlane< T > &Plane)
    Copy constructor.

  • CPlane< T > & operator= (const CPlane< T > &Plane)
    Overloading of assignment operator.

  • const CVector3D< T > & GetDirA () const
    Returns the first direction defining the plane.

  • const CVector3D< T > & GetDirB () const
    Returns the second direction defining the plane.

  • const CPoint3D< T > & GetPoint () const
    Returns the point used to define the plane.

  • CVector3D< T > GetPlaneNormal () const
    Returns a normal to the plane by calculating the cross product of the two directions defining the orientation of the plane.

  • bool Intersect (const CPlane< T > &P, CLine3D< T > &L) const
    Calculates the line for intersection between this plane and plane P.

  • bool Intersect (const CLine3D< T > &L, CPoint3D< T > &Q) const
    Calculates the point for intersection between this plane and line L.

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class ipl::CPlane< T >

Definines a plane by two vectors and a point.

Contains several methods for intersection with lines and planes. The template type should be a floating point, i.e. type float or double.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.5, by ivb@mip.sdu.dk and edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
Ivar Balslev and René Dencker Eriksen

Returns a normal to the plane by calculating the cross product of the two directions defining the orientation of the plane.

CPoint3D< T > &    Q

Calculates the point for intersection between this plane and line L.

Parameters:
L  Line to calculate intersection with.
Q  Intersection point returned in this parameter.
Returns :
False, if the plane and line do not intersect, i.e. they are parallel
